div.p: A sublement of relation and source that allows for the inclusion of an XML element from any XML namespace other than EAD.
[any element from any namespace other than EAD]

A wrapper element that provides a means for incorporating an XML element from any XML encoding language other than EAD3. While not required, to facilitate interoperability the XML included in objectxmlwrap should conform to an open, standard XML schema. An xmlns attribute referencing the namespace URI of the standard should be present, possibly on the ead root element or at the root of the contained foreign element. objectxmlwrap may be used to store related XML data locally rather than linking to external resources in order to facilitate processing or in cases where the related data may not be reliably accessible.
Available in Relax NG and W3C XML Schema versions only â€“ not available in DTD version of EAD3.

ead:source.ead:sourceentry: Dictionary of American biography: including men of the time ... and a supplement

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dictionary of American biography, including men of the time; containing nearly ten thousand notices of persons of both sexes, of native and foreign birth, who have been remarkable, or prominently connected with the arts, sciences, literature, politics, or history of the American continent. Giving also the pronunciation of many of the foreign and peculiar American names, a key to the assumed names of writers, and a supplement
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Drake, Francis S. (Francis Samuel), 1828-1885

ead:descriptivenote.ead:p: Basic biographical information about Nathaniel Freeman was taken from Dictionary of American biography: including men of the time ... and a supplement , page 340.
